directive_ref: CEO DIRECTIVE WAVE 15/15A - AUTONOMOUS GOLDEN NEEDLE HUNT WITH SOURCE ATTRIBUTION

sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Market reports linked the selloff to renewed fears that the BoJ will tighten monetary policy at its meeting this week, threatening the yen...
Bitcoin slid to the $85000 level on December 15, extending its recent decline as global macro risks, leverage unwinding, and thin liquidity...
During the festival season, the crypto markets, much like traditional financial markets, often lean bullish as liquidity improves,...
Crypto may face major volatility as the US job market weakens, pushing the Fed toward a pivotal December policy shift.
Bitcoin prices pushed lower on Thursday, November 20, extending recent losses as macro variables fueled weakness in the markets.

hypothesis_content.title: FUD-Induced Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When multiple consecutive negative catalysts (2+ within 5 days) compress BTC volatility (Bollinger Band Width < 0.15) in NEUTRAL/BEAR regime, the subsequent breakout direction has 70%+ probability of being upward as pessimistic sentiment becomes exhausted.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Current market shows multiple bearish articles ('5 Reasons Bitcoin Fell', 'scarier macro catalyst'). If this creates volatility compression rather than continued selling, it suggests weak hands already exited. Compression breakouts tend to be explosive.
entry_conditions: 2+ negative catalysts within 5 trading days (headline confirmed)
Volume declines during compression period (< 0.8x 20-day avg)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Breakout achieves 1x ATR (14) move in direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: False breakout - price returns inside BBands within 6 hours
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days if no clear breakout occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout occurs to downside with increasing volume, indicating genuine distribution rather than sentiment exhaustion.
